DataElement.preferredName: Person Dietary Supplements Use Frequency Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being._Products in capsule, tablet or liquid form that provide essential nutrients, such as a vitamin, an essential mineral, a protein, an herb, or similar nutritional substance. Nutritional supplements do not require FDA approval to be marketed. (NCI)_Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose._The number of occurrences of something within a given time period. (NCI)_Number

Concepts.definition: Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.
The number of occurrences of something within a given time period.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ReferenceDocuments.name: A measure to quantify intake
ReferenceDocuments.description: A measure to quantify intake from commonly consumed dietary supplements (vitamins, minerals, herbs or other botanicals, or a concentrate, metabolite, constituent, extract, or combination of these ingredients).
